item.title: LG releases cheaper OLED 4K TVs
item.description:
LG releases cheaper OLED 4K TVs

LG has released two lower cost OLED 4K TV models to go along with its high-end G6 and E6. The flat-panel B6 and curved C6 are the latest additions to LG's pretty great lineup of OLED TVs. Both sets will come in 55-inch and 65-inch models, run WebOS 3.0, and support both Dolby Vision and Ultra HD Premium HDR formats.

item.title: Panasonic TX-65DX750 review
item.description:
Panasonic TX-65DX750 review

A few years ago, Panasonic was the boss of TVs. Its plasma tech swatted off the competition like flies, for it was mighty. But then plasma production stopped and Panasonic focussed on LCD TVs, losing its mojo in the process.

item.title: LG's 2016 OLED 4K TV lineup is still expensive, starts at $3,999
item.description:
LG's 2016 OLED 4K TV lineup is still expensive, starts at $3,999

At the highest end of this already pricy scale are LG's models with its new "Picture on Glass" design, which are only around a tenth of an inch thin and feature a translucent glass back. Those start at $4,999 for the 55-inch version and go all the way up to $7,999 for the 65-inch model with integrated soundbar.

item.title: SPECIAL: Das derzeit beste Bild? Panasonic OLED TX-65CZW954 + Ultra HD-BD-Player DMP-UB900 im Ultra HD-BD mit HDR-Check
item.description:
SPECIAL: Das derzeit beste Bild? Panasonic OLED TX-65CZW954 + Ultra HD-BD-Player DMP-UB900 im Ultra HD-BD mit HDR-Check

Nun kommt zusammen, was zusammen gehört: Der Panasonic OLED-TV TX-65CZW954 für 9.999 EUR kann sein Können bei der Präsentation von Ultra HD Blu-ray/HDR-Content im Zusammenspiel mit dem Ultra HD-Blu-ray-Player Panasonic DMP-UB900 unter Beweis stellen. Wichtig: Wir waren zunächst skeptisch, da der CZW954 bereits im Jahre 2015, nach der IFA, auf den Markt gekommen ist.

item.title: Sources: The Upgraded PlayStation 4 is Codenamed NEO, Contains Upgraded CPU, GPU, RAM
item.description:

item.title: Will HDR Lead To Another New HDMI Connector? | HD Guru
item.description:
Will HDR Lead To Another New HDMI Connector? | HD Guru

High dynamic range (HDR) televisions are now in their second year, and most 2016 higher-end displays and supporting 4K Ultra HD source devices are equipped with at least one of the latest HDR-metadata-supporting HDMI 2.0a connectors Meanwhile, 4K content mastered with HDR metadata is ramping up through streaming services and Ultra HD Blu-ray discs.
